author: potuz
content:
Hello, it seems that BALs without ePBS are a problem because we need to change the beacon state and this is the reason why <@363800010518822915> had to cook an entirely separate branch to be able to test  BALs in isolation. 

The reason why it requires a beacon state change is what is in my opinion the tech debt that whenever the payload header changes we need to change the state because the beacon state caches the header. ePBS removes this header entirely from the state (at least in the current iteration of the spec). So what I am asking is if BALs aren't expecting any other change from the CL structures besides this one. If all the changes that are expected are going to be in the engine API, then we can start actually merging our structure PRs to our develop branches, we could test BALs with ePBS enabled and it would make our lives easier when we get to have ePBS implemented

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: I think it would be great if we could have a throwaway branch for at least one of the CLs for BAL only, so we can start setting up networks and testing it, without having to wait for epbs to be finalized

content:
Yeah we discussed that just yesterday and <@845691100072509460> and <@363800010518822915>  are working on a branch with no epbs and only the engine api changes (with the state changes), such that we can start with first BAL devnets right away.
I agree yeah, for the first devnet we should test them together, and then, removing the EL header from the beacon state makes a lot of sense.
